meanings.definition: Tending to spread apart or scatter.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks created a dispersive display in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The dispersive seeds were carried far by the wind.
meanings.sent3: The dispersive confetti made a mess at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her dispersive thoughts wandered in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The dispersive paint splattered across the canvas in a chaotic pattern.

meanings.sent2: The dispersive nature of the substance allowed it to cover a large area.
meanings.sent3: The dispersive robot efficiently sorted the items into different bins.
meanings.sent4: His dispersive skills made him a great organizer.
meanings.sent5: The dispersive fan circulated the cool air throughout the room.
